newsitem.title: USA: Canadian spot natgas prices hold in light trade.
newsitem.headline: Canadian spot natgas prices hold in light trade.

text.p: Canadian spot natgas prices were little changed Monday as trading interest waned because of an industry gas conference in Toronto, market sources said.
Spot gas at the AECO storage hub in Alberta on average slipped one cent to C$1.88-1.89 per gigajoule (GJ) in sluggish trade as mild forecasts put a damper on demand.
Forecasts in Calgary were calling for a high of 20 degrees Celsius today.
Counteracting the low weather-related demand were plant turnarounds. One source estimated that the plant outages were leaving about 700 million cubic feet per day out of the market.
